body:
BTW, just found out this other clever method of parsing out the `name` parameter of a `repository_rule`:

- https://gitlab.arm.com/bazel/toolchain_utils/-/blob/main/toolchain/separator.bzl#L3

```py
SEPARATOR = Label("@local").workspace_name.removesuffix("local")[-1]
```

- https://gitlab.arm.com/bazel/toolchain_utils/-/blob/main/toolchain/resolved/repository.bzl#L37

```py
target = rctx.attr.target or rctx.attr.name.rsplit(SEPARATOR, 1)[1]
```

issue.title: Add `repository_ctx.original_name`

labels.name: team-ExternalDeps
labels.description: External dependency handling, remote repositiories, WORKSPACE file.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
This new attribute contains the original value of the `name` attribute at the instantiation site of the repo rule (e.g., `rctx.original_name` would be `foo` if `rctx.name` is `+ext+foo`).

Fixes #24467

issue.title: [8.1.0] Add `repository_ctx.original_name`

labels.name: team-ExternalDeps
labels.description: External dependency handling, remote repositiories, WORKSPACE file.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
This new attribute contains the original value of the `name` attribute at the instantiation site of the repo rule (e.g., `rctx.original_name` would be `foo` if `rctx.name` is `+ext+foo`).

Fixes #24467

Closes #25121.

RELNOTES: Added `repository_ctx.original_name`, which contains the original value of the `name` attribute as specified at the repo rule call site. 

PiperOrigin-RevId: 722731393
Change-Id: I2f7dada0c44b6bd4c0d2622fa1e97223382a8547 
(cherry picked from commit 8bcfb06e902c3d9b3d0839a1d9a38827f8b68672)

Fixes #25147
